meta.author: Max Tremaine
meta.welcomeMessage:
Hi Stranger!

Welcome to the console of my website. Pretty sweet right? You can find all of the code that I used to put this together in the source, vanilla HTML and JS, and find all of the data at http://www.maxtremaine.com/max_tremaine_dot_com.json.

-Max

basicsOfM&AForFounders.title: Basics of M&A for Founders
basicsOfM&AForFounders.description: What I would have liked to know about M&A before doing some research.

tradingLotteryTickets.title: Trading Lottery Tickets
tradingLotteryTickets.description: Mistaking probability for chance will lead you to a meaningless life.

employeeStockOptions.title: Employee Stock Options in Context
employeeStockOptions.description: A storybook startup and its journey through corporate finance.

theWorstPartOfTravel.title: The Worst Part of Travel
theWorstPartOfTravel.description: Some horror stories about visa applications from Sherpa's customer discovery interviews.

nobodyLikesTravelVisas.title: Nobody Likes Travel Visas
nobodyLikesTravelVisas.description: An overview of some of my findings researching travel visa requirements, and people's experiences applying for travel visas.

yourPhoneWillReplaceYourPassport.title: Your Phone Will Replace Your Passport
yourPhoneWillReplaceYourPassport.description: Some of my thoughts on the changing travel documentation landscape.

lawsOnYourPhone.title: Laws on Your Phone
lawsOnYourPhone.description: Some of my thoughts on the application of mobile technologies to the consumption of legal and regulatory data.

theSovereignIndividual.title: The Sovereign Individual
theSovereignIndividual.author: James Dale Davidson & William Rees-Mogg
theSovereignIndividual.description: A truly forward thinking book about how the internet changes the balance of power between governments and individuals. This book is obsessively well sourced, and can serve as the launchpad for dozens of reading binges. The ultimate success of the book can be measured in the number of specific predictions that have come to fruition.
theSovereignIndividual.favouriteQuote: Just as the attempts to preserve the power of knights in armor were doomed to fail in the face of gunpowder weapons, so the modern notions of nationalism and citizenship are doomed to be short-circuited by microtechnology.

zeroToOne.title: Zero to One
zeroToOne.author: Peter Thiel
zeroToOne.description: Thiel's unique take on the business book. Instead of truths about business or alegorical tales, he focuses on questions and systems that creative people have to consider when trying to create something new. This book really made me stop and think about my life and my business.
zeroToOne.favouriteQuote: All failed companies are the same: they failed to escape competition.

innovatorsDilemma.title: The Innovator's Dilemma
innovatorsDilemma.author: Clayton Christiensen
innovatorsDilemma.description: One of the most thought provoking books I've ever read. Disruptive Innovation is a framework that is much more selective than it is typically used, and I have had a lot of fun trying to apply it to case studies that I see. Great read.
innovatorsDilemma.favouriteQuote: The techniques that worked so extraordinarily well when applied to sustaining technologies, however, clearly failed badly when applied to markets or applications that did not yet exist.

freeToChoose.title: Free to Choose
freeToChoose.author: Milton Friedman
freeToChoose.description: This book had a fundamental effect on me when I was forming my political opinions. The practical lense to politics is generally underexplored, and this book makes a great case for following outcomes over intentions.
freeToChoose.favouriteQuote: The combination of economic and political power in the same hands is a sure recipe for tyranny.

optionsVolatilityAndPricing.title: Option Volatility and Pricing
optionsVolatilityAndPricing.author: Sheldon Natenberg
optionsVolatilityAndPricing.description: The options trading bible. Absolutely the best book if you want to understand how options are priced and valued.
optionsVolatilityAndPricing.favouriteQuote: You could say that implied volatility is the marketplace's own forecast of future volatility. It's the consensus among all traders in the marketplace about what they think the future volatility is going to be based on the prices they're currently bidding and asking for the options being traded.

sexTrafficking.title: Sex Trafficking
sexTrafficking.author: Siddharth Kara
sexTrafficking.description: An eye opening book about the darkest side of humanity.
sexTrafficking.favouriteQuote: The sequence is undeniable; desire leads to suffering, suffering leads to anger, anger leads to violence, and violence destroys the world.

theAscentOfMoney.title: The Ascent of Money
theAscentOfMoney.author: Niall Ferguson
theAscentOfMoney.description: It's impossible to understand markets without understanding finance, and it's impossible to understand finance without understanding money. This is a great book on money.
theAscentOfMoney.favouriteQuote: There's really no such thing as 'the future', singular. There are only multiple, unforeseeable futures, which will never lose their capacity to take us by surprise.

deadAid.title: Dead Aid
deadAid.author: Dambisa Moyo
deadAid.description: A book that rocked the way I thought about foreign aid. Very easy read, and highly informative.
deadAid.favouriteQuote: Western donors have an aid industry to feed [Western] farmers.

thisTimeIsDifferent.title: This Time is Different
thisTimeIsDifferent.author: Carmen Reinhard & Kenneth Rogoff
thisTimeIsDifferent.description: Every unprecidented market bust actually follows highly similar features. Really good book to help you understand what to look for in a bubble.
thisTimeIsDifferent.favouriteQuote: More money has been lost because of four words than at the point of a gun. Those words are "This time is different."

confidenceGame.title: Confidence Game
confidenceGame.author: Christine Richard
confidenceGame.description: An amazing look into the regulatory failures that led to the real estate bubble in the United States.
confidenceGame.favouriteQuote: He didn’t ask people in the room what they thought about the emperor’s new clothes or if they wondered whether the emperor might be a bit cold… He just pointed his finger and said “Naked!”

industryIsTheEnemy.quote: Industry is the enemy of melancholy.
industryIsTheEnemy.author: William F. Buckley

noSolutions.quote: There are no solutions. There are only tradeoffs.
noSolutions.author: Thomas Sowell

dontTakeRefuge.quote: Don't take refuge in the false security of consensus.
dontTakeRefuge.author: Christopher Hitchens

dataIsTheSword.quote: Data is the sword of the 21st century, those who wield it well, the Samurai.
dataIsTheSword.author: Jonathan Rosenberg

timeMakesFools.quote: Time makes fools of us all. Our only comfort is that greater shall come after us.
timeMakesFools.author: Eric Temple Bell

concentratedPower.quote: Concentrated power is not rendered harmless by the good intentions of those who create it.
concentratedPower.author: Milton Friedman

inMathematicsTheArt.quote: In mathematics the art of proposing a question must be held of higher value than solving it.
inMathematicsTheArt.author: Georg Cantor

thereIsNoDignity.quote: There is no dignity quite so impressive, and no one independence quite so important, as living within your means.
thereIsNoDignity.author: Calvin Coolidge

asFarAsTheLawsOfMathematics.quote: As far as the laws of mathematics refer to reality, they are not certain; and as far as they are certain, they do not refer to reality.
asFarAsTheLawsOfMathematics.author: Albert Einstein

writingAsWork.quote: Stop thinking about writing as art. Think of it as work. If you’re an artist, whatever you do is going to be art. If you’re not an artist, at least you can do a good day’s work.
writingAsWork.author: Paddy Chayefsky

theFirstLessonOfEconomics.quote: The first lesson of economics is scarcity: there is never enough of anything to fully satisfy all those who want it. The first lesson of politics is to disregard the first lesson of economics.
theFirstLessonOfEconomics.author: Thomas Sowell

theDonQuixoteOfTheTwentyFirstCentury.quote: The Don Quixote of the twenty-first century will not be a knight-errant struggling to revive the glories of feudalism but a bureaucrat in a brown suit, a tax collector yearning for a citizen to audit.
theDonQuixoteOfTheTwentyFirstCentury.author: James Dale Davidson & William Rees Mogg

ifYouThinkOfTheWorld.quote: [If] you think of the world as consisting of lottery tickets, you have set yourself up to lose. ... Even though there may be things that involve irreducible elements of luck, it's not an intellectual truth about the world.
ifYouThinkOfTheWorld.author: Peter Thiel

todayWeExaminePeople.quote: Today, we examine people under an electron microscope if they're running for dogcatcher, and I think this is the single biggest reason that more talented people don't run for public office... the extreme transparency in some ways naturally leads in a toxic direction, away from policy.
todayWeExaminePeople.author: Peter Thiel

visaRunInc.title: Co-Founder & CEO
visaRunInc.description: Business leader of a small team with an innovative product. Established relationships with leaders in the Travel Visa Services market. Developed lean marketing and sales processes.

theRevenueU.title: Market Validation & Lean Startup Consultant
theRevenueU.description: Facilitated the Market Validation Lab program. Designed course materials to establish Lean Startup methodologies for OCE-backed startups. Advised startup leadership teams in achieving market-ready products.

tier1CRMFullTime.title: Multiple Roles
tier1CRMFullTime.description: Established the information security policies and procedures. Coordinated tests of the information security procedures. Reported directly to the leadership team.

hubspotInbound.title: Inbound Certification
hubspotInbound.description: Gained a basic understanding of best practices and tools in Inbound Marketing.

nielsenAnalyst.title: Market Research Analyst
nielsenAnalyst.description: Won 'Commitment to Excellence (2013)' for assissting with analysis and insights for a white paper on Price Divergence. Led and contributed to research on the Canadian Retail/CPG market. Acted as first point of contact for Imperial Oil and Canadian Tire accounts.

canadianSecuritiesCourse.title: Canadian Securities Course
canadianSecuritiesCourse.description: Certified to sell Mutual Funds in Canada.

googleAnalytics.title: Digital Analytics Fundamentals
googleAnalytics.description: Trained to use Google's digital analytics tools.

laurierCHBA.title: Combination Hons. BA Political Science & Psychology (Min. Economics)
laurierCHBA.description: Rigorous study in statistics and social research.
